spec.description:
Complete Elasticsearch scale out stack initially comprised of :
* 3 Master nodes for cluster consensus
* 4 Data nodes for ingest, search etc
* 1 Client Node for scatter/gather, search etc
* Single Kibana instance for data visualisation

Access:

Elasticsearch master node VMs: 
* ssh -i ./keys.pem -l centos @@{Elastic_Master.address[0]}@@

Elasticsearch data node VMs: 
* ssh -i ./keys.pem -l centos @@{Elastic_Data.address[0]}@@

Elasticsearch client node VM
*  ssh -i ./keys.pem -l centos @@{Elastic_Client.address}@@

 Kibana VM Access : ssh -i ./keys.pem -l centos @@{KibanaAHV.address}@@

 Kibana GUI : @@{KibanaAHV.address}@@:@@{KibanaAHV.kibana_port}@@

cloud_init.user_data:
#cloud-config
users:
  - name: centos
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{INSTANCE_PUBLIC_KEY}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']

#cloud-config
users:
  - name: centos
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{INSTANCE_PUBLIC_KEY}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']

#cloud-config
users:
  - name: centos
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{INSTANCE_PUBLIC_KEY}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']

#cloud-config
users:
  - name: centos
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{INSTANCE_PUBLIC_KEY}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

set -ex

sudo /usr/sbin/swapoff -a 
sudo sed -i '/swap/ s/^/#/' /etc/fstab

sudo yum install -y lsscsi yum-utils wget
sudo yum install -y lvm2 device-mapper-persistent-data
sudo yum install -y java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

sudo rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch
sudo wget https://artifacts.elastic.co/downloads/elasticsearch/elasticsearch-7.0.1-x86_64.rpm
sudo yum localinstall -y elasticsearch-7.0.1-x86_64.rpm 

sudo sed -i 's/#cluster.name: my-application/cluster.name: @@{elastic_cluster_name}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/#node.name: node-1/node.name: ${HOSTNAME}/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.data: false' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.master: true' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i '$ a node.ingest: false' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's%path.data: /var/lib/elasticsearch%path.data: @@{elastic_data_path}@@%' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#bootstrap/bootstrap/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#network.host: 192.168.0.1/network.host: _eth0:ipv4_/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#http.port: 9200/http.port: @@{elastic_http_port}@@/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
#sudo sed -i 's/^#discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes:/discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes: 1/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml  
sudo sed -i 's/#discovery.seed_hosts: \["host1", "host2"\]/discovery.seed_hosts: ["@@{Elastic_MasterAHV.address[0]}@@", "@@{Elastic_MasterAHV.address[1]}@@", "@@{Elastic_MasterAHV.address[2]}@@"]/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/#cluster.initial_master_nodes: \["node-1", "node-2"\]/cluster.initial_master_nodes: ["@@{Elastic_MasterAHV.address[0]}@@", "@@{Elastic_MasterAHV.address[1]}@@", "@@{Elastic_MasterAHV.address[2]}@@"]/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
sudo sed -i 's/-Xms1g/-Xms@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options
sudo sed -i 's/-Xmx1g/-Xmx@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options

sudo echo -e "vm.swappiness=0\nvm.max_map_count=262144\nvm.dirty_background_ratio=1\nvm.dirty_ratio=40" | sudo tee /etc/sysctl.d/vm.conf

sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d
sudo echo -e "[Service]\nLimitMEMLOCK=infinity" | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d/override.conf

sudo /usr/sbin/sysctl --system

#/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/awk '{print $6}' | /usr/bin/grep /dev/sd | /usr/bin/grep -v sda | /usr/bin/xargs pvcreate
DISKS=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/egrep -v "sr|sda" | /usr/bin/awk '{print $NF}' | /usr/bin/tr '\n' ' ')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate esdata $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -i 6 -l 100%VG -n esdata esdata
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata
sudo sleep 30
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /elastic/esdata01
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata @@{elastic_data_path}@@
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/esdata-esdata \t @@{elastic_data_path}@@ \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" | sudo tee /etc/fstab
sudo /usr/bin/chown -R elasticsearch:elasticsearch @@{elastic_data_path}@@

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable elasticsearch.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start elasticsearch.service

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

sudo /usr/sbin/swapoff -a 
sudo sed -i '/swap/ s/^/#/' /etc/fstab

sudo yum install -y lsscsi yum-utils wget
sudo yum install -y lvm2 device-mapper-persistent-data

sudo sed -i 's/-Xmx1g/-Xmx@@{java_heap_size}@@g/' /etc/elasticsearch/jvm.options

sudo echo -e "vm.swappiness=0\nvm.max_map_count=262144\nvm.dirty_background_ratio=1\nvm.dirty_ratio=40" | sudo tee /etc/sysctl.d/vm.conf

sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d
sudo echo -e "[Service]\nLimitMEMLOCK=infinity" | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service.d/override.conf

sudo /usr/sbin/sysctl --system

#/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/awk '{print $6}' | /usr/bin/grep /dev/sd | /usr/bin/grep -v sda | /usr/bin/xargs pvcreate
DISKS=$(/usr/bin/lsscsi | /usr/bin/egrep -v "sr|sda" | /usr/bin/awk '{print $NF}' | /usr/bin/tr '\n' ' ')
sudo /usr/sbin/pvcreate $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/vgcreate esdata $(echo $DISKS)
sudo /usr/sbin/lvcreate -y -i 6 -l 100%VG -n esdata esdata
sudo /usr/sbin/mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata
sudo sleep 30
sudo /usr/bin/mkdir -p /elastic/esdata01
sudo /usr/bin/mount /dev/mapper/esdata-esdata @@{elastic_data_path}@@
sudo echo -e "/dev/mapper/esdata-esdata \t @@{elastic_data_path}@@ \t xfs \t defaults,auto,noexec \t 0 0" | sudo tee /etc/fstab
sudo /usr/bin/chown -R elasticsearch:elasticsearch @@{elastic_data_path}@@

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable elasticsearch.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start elasticsearch.service

#!/bin/bash 

set -ex

HOST=$(hostname)
#echo $HOST

sudo yum install -y wget
sudo /usr/bin/rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch

sudo wget https://artifacts.elastic.co/downloads/kibana/kibana-7.0.1-x86_64.rpm
sudo /usr/bin/yum localinstall -y kibana-7.0.1-x86_64.rpm

#IP_ADDRESS=$(ip a show dev eth0 | grep -w inet | awk '{print $2}' | sed 's/\/22//')
sudo sed -i 's/^#server.port: 5601/server.port: @@{kibana_port}@@/' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i 's/^#server.host: "localhost"/server.host: @@{KibanaAHV.address}@@/' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i "s/^#server.name: \"your-hostname\"/server.name: $HOST/" /etc/kibana/kibana.yml
sudo sed -i 's%^#elasticsearch.hosts: \["http://localhost:9200"\]%elasticsearch.hosts: \["http://@@{Elastic_Client.address}@@:@@{elastic_http_port}@@"\]%' /etc/kibana/kibana.yml

sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo /bin/systemctl daemon-reload
sudo /bin/systemctl enable kibana.service
sudo /bin/systemctl start kibana.service

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

sudo /usr/sbin/swapoff -a 
sudo sed -i '/swap/ s/^/#/' /etc/fstab

sudo yum install -y lsscsi yum-utils wget
sudo yum install -y lvm2 device-mapper-persistent-data
sudo yum install -y java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

#sudo sed -i 's/#discovery.seed_hosts: \["host1", "host2"\]/discovery.seed_hosts: ["@@{address}@@"]/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
#sudo sed -i 's/#cluster.initial_master_nodes: \["node-1", "node-2"\]/cluster.initial_master_nodes: ["@@{address}@@"]/' /etc/elasticsearch/elasticsearch.yml
